p: The weed B. pilosa has been reported as a noxious weed in many countries and infests many crops. It is characterized by efficient seeds dispersion [ 46]. The allelopathic control of the EOs from various plants was tested against this weed such as Cullen plicata [ 13], Xanthium Strumarium [ 32], and Tagetes minuta [ 47]. The EO from C. plicata showed comparable phytotoxic activity on the germination of B. pilosa, where it attained IC 50 values of 49.4 µL L −1 [ 13]. The EO of C. procera in the present study revealed stronger activity than those of C. plicata on radicle growth and shoot growth of B. pilosa.
